intro: Pavetta hochstetteri var. mollirama, commonly known as the velvet pavetta, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The varietal form mollirama is distinguished by its softer, more velvety leaf texture compared to the typical variety.
